availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sophronia Faulconer Whitaker in Trimble County in December 1850. Father of John W. Whitaker, Mary E. Whitaker, Arminta Whitaker, Franklin Whitaker, and Clara Whitaker. Resident of Trimble County, Kentucky in 1840. Farmer in Trimble County in 1850. Farmer in Trimble County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, City/District, p. 322.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, District 1, p. 430B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 252.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, Bedford, p. 195B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages, Film #000420390, p. 280.
